page.title: 13THE CHURCH (C of E)
page.content:
The church of St.John the Evangelist in Cornish Hall End is a fairly small brick building,dating from about 1840. It originally had a small tower with 2 pinnacles on either side of the west end.In 19ll the church was'beautified' by courtesy of the local squire.Oak pews, new pulpit and a stained glass window in the east end were installed. Also a larger tower built to replace the small one.The belfry houses only 1 bell. The pinnacles were removed in about l965 when they became unsafe _ a young man in the village had this as his first job for a local builder. There is a tiny chapel,unused now, to the south of the chancel.
The churchyard is now closed for burials,the cemetery being a quarter of a mile away,on the road to Tinkers Green.
